commentary.a: En pu, las palabras "a" y "kin" son sinónimos. No obstante, en uso común (antes y después de pu), "a" y "kin" son palabras diferentes, con sus propios significados.
commentary.akesi: En pu, "akesi" significó "animal no bonito", pero esta definición ha caído de uso y fue eliminado en las anotaciones de pu en ku.
commentary.alasa: En algunas comunidades, el uso de "alasa" como un preverbo que significa "intentar a" o "tratar a" es igual o más común que "lukin". En pu, solo "lukin"/"oko" tiene este significado.
commentary.ale:
"ali" es una alternativa a "ale", creado en una encuesta en 2002 para evitar confusión con "ala". Pero el uso de "ale" todavía queda más común que el uso de "ali".
La mayoría de les hablantes dicen que no entienden el "abundante" significado, al menos, fuera de contexto.
"20, 120" fueran significados no-pu en uso junto con "100" anteriormente; hoy en día son prácticamente desconocidos.
commentary.ali: "ali" es una alternativa a "ale", creado en una encuesta en 2002 para evitar confusión con "ala". Pero el uso de "ale" sobre "ali" ha sido más común desde la publicación de pu. Generalmente no se considera una palabra propia.
commentary.anpa: En uso común (antes y después de pu), "anpa" significa "lugar que está abajo". En pu, "noka" tiene ese significado en su lugar.
commentary.anu: El uso de "anu" como palabra de contenido que significa "elegir" o "escoger" sigue siendo polémico.
commentary.apeja: Según jan Sonja, "apeja" nunca apareció en ningún diccionario de toki pona antes de pu hecho por ella y nunca fue promocionado por ella. Posiblemente fue "solamente una idea experimental en un post del foro".
commentary.en: Hay varios análisis del rol sintáctico de "en". El intento original fue para usarlo como "y". Fue cambiado (por una encuesta en 2002) para ser usado con los sustantivos del sujeto. Un análisis más reciente (del Día de las bromas de abril 2021) lo trata como un marcador de sujetos.
commentary.esun: According to jan Sonja, "esun was told [to her] by a taxi driver who spoke a language from the Akan family in West Africa".
commentary.jan: Hay dos lados del concepto: "entidad sensible" y "Homo sapiens". Importa para los casos extremos (por ejemplo: los extraterrestres, los hombres lobos, etc). Cuál sentido es más central sigue siendo controversial.
commentary.jelo: Algunos aumentan "jelo" para incluir la verde de la lima, pero este no es común.
commentary.jonke: Creado en referencia al fandom de Untitled Goose Game.
commentary.kamalawala: The word is from a story called "jan pi Kamalawala". A character's name is described as "nimi Jan pi Kama e Lawa Ala", and a shortened version given as "nimi Kamalawala". jan Kipo is responsible for it becoming a word instead of just a name.
commentary.kepeken: Si "kepeken" debería ser usado con o sin "e" en una posición predicativa (significando "usar") sigue siendo controversial.
commentary.kijetesantakalu: Creado de chiste del Día de las bromas de abril en 2009.
commentary.kiki: La palabra es prestada de la versión de 2001 de Vilanyur S Ramachandran y Edward Hubbard del experimento psicolingüístico de 1912 de Wolfgang Köhler. El experimento estudió el simbolismo sonoro de las palabras "bouba" y "kiki".
commentary.kili: In post-ku 2021, metaphorical definitions for kili have been suggested, including but not limited to "offspring" and "product", and are moderately popular. It is not yet clear whether this will remain in use long-term.
commentary.kin:
In common usage (both before and after pu), "a" and "kin" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms.
Underwent significant changes in usage in 2002, alongside "en" and (now obsolete) "kan".
commentary.ko: The "clinging form" definition was elaborated to mean "a shape or mass that sticks or clings; a clot, a thick or viscous lump, a clump that can be reshaped".
commentary.kokosila: En esperanto, "krokodili" significa "hablar entre esperantistas sin usar esperanto", y es parte de la cultura esperantista.
commentary.konwe:
Conway refers to John Horton Conway, creator of the cellular automaton Game of Life.
konwe's intended meaning extends beyond just "living" and "life." It can be used to describe rocks or rivers or other nonliving things
commentary.ku: For ways to buy a copy of the book, visit the official Toki Pona website.
commentary.kule: in addition to its pu-definitions, kule is sometimes used to talk about more general kinds of categories, like type, kind, flavour, gender, etc.
commentary.lukin: In common usage (both before and after pu), "lukin" and "oko" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms. Those who consider them synonyms typically don't use "oko" at all, preferring "lukin" in all circumstances. The usage of "alasa" as a preverb meaning "try to" is more common than "lukin". In pu, only "lukin" has this meaning. A very common beginner mistake is treating "lukin" as if it means "appearance", due to the mistakenly equating the "visual" meaning as in "pona lukin (visually good)" to mean "looks good".
commentary.misikeke: The word was used privately by jan Sonja up until November 2019, when she mentioned it in the ma pona pi toki pona discord server as a word she was experimenting with. It is believed the word was originally coined in 2007-2009 alongside pan, esun, apeja, monsuta, and pu, but this cannot be proven.
commentary.namako: In common usage (both before and after pu), "sin" and "namako" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms. Those who consider them synonyms typically don't use "namako" at all, preferring "sin" in all circumstances.
commentary.nimisin: Mostly used in conversations in English. Likely was popularised by the :nimisin: emote in ma pona, which was originally used to notify Atawan (maintainer of "nimi ale") about newly coined words. In common speech, the meaning got extended to include most or all non-pu words, regardless if they were coined recently or not.
commentary.noka: In a 2002 poll, "jalan" was proposed to replace "noka". However, it failed to get enough votes. In pu, "noka" has the meaning of "place that is down". In common usage (both before and after pu), "anpa" has that meaning instead. noka had speculative and/or joking use for numbers, comparable to luka: ten, twenty, negative five.
commentary.oko: In common usage (both before and after pu), "lukin" and "oko" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms. Those who consider them synonyms typically don't use "oko" at all, preferring "lukin" in all circumstances, though some speakers do the opposite and use "oko" exclusively instead.
commentary.olin: En toki pona, "olin" no significa "gustar mucho". Indica una conexión emocional, no una preferencia
commentary.omekapo: Coined by jan Maliku in reference to the message "o moku e kala pona", which jan Sonja wrote on their copy of Toki Pona: The Language of Good during a Texas meetup.
commentary.ona: Coined in a poll in 2002. Replaced "iki", which was deemed too similar to "ike". Other options in the poll included "ipi", as well as "i" in a previous poll.
commentary.open: Some proficient speakers use open as a preverb that means "start to," that goes along with the complimentary pini preverb "to stop"
commentary.penpo: Creado en referencia al evento "tenpo pi toki pona taso" de ma pona pi toki pona, acortándolo a "tenpo penpo".
commentary.pi: The usage of "pi" to mean "of" (marking a possessor) is heavily discouraged nowadays, preferring it to only be used for regrouping within phrases.
commentary.pini: Some proficient speakers use pini as a preverb that means "to stop," that goes along with the complimentary open preverb "start to"
commentary.poki: poki is sometimes used as "category" or to express types of things. One example is roles or groups, in discord chat contexts
commentary.pu: For ways to buy a copy of the book, visit the official Toki Pona website.
commentary.san:
More popular than the synonymous (and older) tuli.
san was also part of a set of 10 digit words created by jan Lenoka: lenke, jatu, ini, san, se, nun, loku, take, patu, kajo (0 through 9). All of these coinages except for san lack notability to be included in the main dictionary. They can be found in the sandbox.
commentary.seli: In pu, definitions of seli are described as adjectives. ku's pu corrections clarify that these refer to nouns instead.
commentary.sin: In common usage (both before and after pu), "sin" and "namako" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms. Those who consider them synonyms typically don't use "namako" at all, preferring "sin" in all circumstances.
commentary.su: This word was originally coined in ku as a reserved word for jan Sonja's future use. It was redefined upon the release of the first su book, making its status as a ku word debatable.
commentary.sutopatikuna: Coined by Alexandre Baudry in 2009 in response to jan Sonja coining "kijetesantakalu" as part of 2009's April Fools.
commentary.taso: Some proficient speakers use taso as a connector between sentences (X taso Y), similar to "X, but Y," as though taso behaved like la grammatically.
commentary.te: May be paired with "to", or used on its own. It is unclear how accepted either approach is among te / to users.
commentary.to: May be paired with "te", or used on its own. It is unclear how accepted either approach is among te / to users.
commentary.tonsi: Widely regarded in the community to be a crucial addition to toki pona. Occasionally referred to as an "honorary pu word" to highlight its status, or equated to a pu word outright.
commentary.unpa: Also defined as "have marital relations with" in pu; removed due to potential confusion.
commentary.usawi: Originally, usawi also included "technology so complex it's impossible to tell apart from magic" in its meaning, but this meaning has been deprecated by the creator.
commentary.uta: El punto en el sitelen pona de "uta" es para distinguir "luka-uta" de "moku".
commentary.wa: A veces analizado como una variante de "a".
commentary.wasoweli: First used as the name for a species in a mod for Caves of Qud created by akesi kon Nalasuni. Later appeared in ku as exclusively part of a translation for "penguin".
commentary.wuwojiti: Puede ser visto no como una palabra en toki pona, sino un instrumento de memorización para referirse a las sílabas "prohibidas". A veces está aumentado a wuwojitinmanna para incluir a las consonantes nasales consecutivas ilegales.
commentary.yupekosi: Coined as a random keystroke. It is presumed jan Sonja used "y" by mistake, but then made it part of the joke by adding "nobody knows how to pronounce the y".

definitions.a: (interjección) ah, oh, ja, eh, ey; (partícula) [colocado después de algo para énfasis o emoción]
definitions.akesi: reptil, anfibio, criatura con escamas, criatura que se arrastra
definitions.ala: no, nada; (partícula) [niega una palabra o frase]; (partícula) [usada en la estructura "~ ala ~" para formar una pregunta de sí o no]; cero
definitions.ante: diferente, cambiado; modificar, cambiar; otro; diferencia
definitions.anu: (partícula) [separa varias posibilidades, reemplazando otra partícula], o | ALT escoger, decidir
definitions.apeja: culpa, verguenza, deshonra, estigma, desgracia; avergonzar, exponer, acusar, deshonrar, rechazar, alienar
definitions.awen: durable, mantenido, protegido, seguro, esperar, estar; (pv.) continuar, mantener
definitions.esun: mercado, tienda, feria, bazar, transacción de negocios
definitions.ijo: cosa, objeto, entidad, ser (vivo), materia, fenómeno
definitions.ike: mal, malo, negativo; no esencial, irrelevante | ALT complicado, complejo
definitions.insa: centro, contenido, adentro, entre; órgano interno, estomago
definitions.isipin: pensar, imaginar, creer, recordar, racionalizar; pensamiento, idea, reflexión, recuerdo
definitions.jaki: asqueroso, obsceno, enfermizo, tóxico, sucio, antihigiénico
definitions.jami: rico, delicioso; que estimula o causa una experiencia sensorial positiva
definitions.jasima: reflejar, resonar, hacer eco; espejo, superficie reflectante ; estar en el extremo opuesto
definitions.kala: pez, animal marino, criatura del mar
definitions.kalama: producir un sonido, recitar, pronunciar en voz alta
definitions.kama: llegar, próximo, futuro, convocar; (pv.) convertirse, lograr, suceder a
definitions.kapesi: marrón, castaño, café, pardo; gris, rucio, plomo
definitions.ken: capaz, habilidad, permiso; posibilidad, quizás; permitir; (preverbo) poder (hacer)
definitions.kepeken: usando, con, mediante, por medio de
definitions.kijetesantakalu: cualquier animal de la familia Procyonidae, tal como los mapaches, coatíes, kinkajús, olingos y cacomixtles | ALT cualquier animal de la superfamilia Musteloidea, tal como los mapaches, comadrejas, nutrias, mofetas y pandas rojos
definitions.kipisi: partir, dividir, escindir, cortar, rebanar; afilado, filoso, puntiagudo
definitions.ko: semisólido: pasta, masa, arena, harina, polvo; fofo, deformable, pegajoso
definitions.kokosila: hablar un idioma distinto a Toki Pona en un entorno donde Toki Pona sería más apropiado
definitions.kon: aire, respiro; esencia, espíritu; realidad oculta, agente invisible
definitions.konwe: vida, autonomía; ser autónomo, ser vivo, organismo; vivo, animado, dinámico; animar, traer a la vida
definitions.ku: interactuar con el libro Toki Pona Dictionary (2021) de Sonja Lang
definitions.kule: color, pigmento; categoría, género, sabor; colorido, diverso
definitions.kulijo: (interjección casual para expresar apreciación o reconocimiento); guay, bacán, piola, genial, cool
definitions.kulupu: comunidad, compañía, grupo, nación, sociedad, tribu
definitions.kute: oreja, órgano auditivo; oír, escuchar, prestar atención, hacer caso
definitions.la: (partícula) [entre la frase de contexto y la frase principal]
definitions.lanpan: tomar, coger, agarrar, capturar, recibir, obtener, conseguir
definitions.lawa: cabeza, mente; controlar, dirigir, guiar, poseer (algo), planear, regular, norma, gobernar
definitions.leko: cuadrado, cubo, bloque; por ejemplo, ladrillos, escaleras
definitions.len: tela, ropa, tejido, textil; cubrir, escondido, secreto, privado
definitions.li: (partícula) [marca el comienzo de un verbo indicativo, excepto cuando el sujeto es mi o sina]
definitions.lili: chico, pequeño, corto; poco; un poco; joven
definitions.linja: cosa larga y flexible; cuerda, cabello, vello, hilo | ALT línea, connección
definitions.linluwi: red, internet, conexión; tejer, entrelazar, trenzar
definitions.lipu: objeto plano y plegable, por ejemplo, hoja, tarjeta; texto o documento escrito, por ejemplo, libro, sitio web, tablilla de barro
definitions.lon: presente, existente, real, verdad; (preposición) ubicada en, durante, en, en el contexto de
definitions.luka: mano, brazo, miembro táctil, extremidad que agarra; agarrar, interactuar con, tocar; (número) cinco
definitions.lukin: ver, mirar, examinar, leer; visual; ojo, órgano visual; (preverbo) intentar
definitions.ma: la tierra, suelo, fuera, mundo, país, territorio
definitions.mani: dinero, ahorros, riqueza, animal domesticado largo
definitions.meso: medio, centro; mediano, mediocre, más o menos; ni uno ni el otro, ni una cosa ni la otra, lo es pero no lo es
definitions.misa: animal del orden Rodentia, Lagomorpha o Eulipotyphla; rata, ratón, ardilla, conejo, topo, musaraña, erizo, roedor; {~ suli} capibara
definitions.monsuta: miedo, temor, pavor, terror, horror; monstruo, (de)predador; amenaza, peligro
definitions.mu: (sonido o comunicación animal) | ALT (vocalización no verbal)
definitions.mun: luna, objeto celeste, astro, estrella | ALT brillo, luz brillante, luz en la oscuridad
definitions.mute: mucho, más, varios, muy; cantidad | ALT tres (o más), 20
definitions.n: (indica pensar, ponderar, reconocer, estar de acuerdo, o tararear)
definitions.namako: {ver sin} | ALT ornamentación, especia; extra, adicional
definitions.nasa: poco común, raro, extraño, ridículo; borracho, drogado
definitions.nasin: método, doctrina, tradición; camino, ruta, estilo, forma
definitions.nimisin: neologismo; cualquier palabra en Toki Pona no presente en pu, cualquier palabra nueva en Toki Pona, cualquier palabra de broma en Toki Pona
definitions.noka: pie, pierna, pata, órgano usado para locomoción; parte inferior | ALT diez, veinte, cinco negativo
definitions.o: (partícula) [marca el final de una frase vocativa], ¡oye! ¡oiga!; (partícula) [marca el comienzo de una frase imperativo u optativo (un comando, deseo, o instrucción)], deber
definitions.ojuta: adaptación del meme "ligma": chupa + mis (bolas); (literalmente) "o uta" (chupa)
definitions.oke: de acuerdo, está bien, vale, okey; (señal de reconocimiento o aceptación)
definitions.oko: ver, mirar, examinar, leer; visual; ojo, órgano visual; (preverbo) intentar
definitions.olin: tener una fuerte conexión emocional con; por ejemplo: cariño, gratitud, compasión, respeto; relaciones platónicas, románticas, o familiares
definitions.omekapo: chao, adiós, hasta luego; (literalmente) "o moku e kala pona" (come un buen pescado)
definitions.ona: él, ella, ello, elle, lo, la, le, ellos, ellas
definitions.open: empezar, comenzar, iniciar; abrir; encender, prender
definitions.owe: orwelliano, totalitario, relacionado al Gran Hermano (de 1984), antónimo de kamalawala
definitions.pake: parar, detener, dejar de; bloquear, obstaculizar, interrumpir; prevenir, impedir
definitions.pali: trabajo, actividad; crear, construir, diseñar; poner esfuerzo, actuar en
definitions.palisa: algo largo y duro, palo, algo cilíndrico
definitions.pan: cereal, grano; cebada, maíz, avena, arroz, trigo; pan, pasta
definitions.pana: dar, entregar, enviar, emitir, soltar, lanzar
definitions.pi: (partícula) [agrupa las siguientes palabras para modificar la palabra anterior]
definitions.pika: eléctrico, electrónico, que conduce electricidad, mecánico, en línea; electricidad, rayo, relámpago, trueno, red
definitions.pilin: experiencia; por ejemplo, emoción, tacto; corazón (físico o emocional)
definitions.poka: cadera, cintura; al lado de, cerca de, en los alrededores de | ALT junto a (comitativo), del lado de
definitions.poki: contenedor, bolsa, bol, vaso, alacena, armario, despensa, cajón, vasija, recipiente
definitions.pona: bueno, positivo, útil; amable, pacífico; bien; simple, fácil
definitions.powe: irreal, falso, equivocado, de mentira; fingir, simular; engañar
definitions.pu: interactuar con el libro Toki Pona: The Language of Good de Sonja Lang
definitions.puwa: suave, blando, mullido, esponjoso, felpudito (algo que intenta regresar a su forma original si se comprime)
definitions.sama: igual, similar, mismo, idéntico; (preposición) similar a, igual que
definitions.seli: fuego, quemar; quemador de cocina, reacción química, fuente de calor; cálido, caliente
definitions.selo: piel, borde, forma exterior, cáscara, concha
definitions.seme: (partícula) [indica una pregunta, marcando información que falta en una frase]; ¿qué? ¿cuál? ¿cómo?
definitions.sewi: arriba, encima de, parte más alta, algo elevado; sorprendente, inspirador, divino, sagrado, sobrenatural
definitions.sijelo: cuerpo, forma, estado físico, torso, sustancia
definitions.sike: cosa esférica o circular; bola, círculo, ciclo, esfera, rueda; año
definitions.sinpin: cara, pared; parte frontal, al frente de
definitions.sitelen: imágen, fotografía, representación, símbolo, carácter (ej: letra), escritura
definitions.sona: saber, saber cómo, conocer; habilidad, conocimiento, sabiduría; (pv.) saber cómo hacer
definitions.su: interactuar con uno de los libros ilustrados de Sonja Lang de la serie que comienza con "El maravilloso mago de Oz"
definitions.suli: grande, pesado, largo, alto, ancho; importante; adulto
definitions.suno: sol; luz, brillo, iluminación, radiancia, reflejo; fuente de luz
definitions.supa: superficie horizontal; cosa para colocar y/o apoyar otras cosas
definitions.taki: pegajoso, pringoso, adhesivo, pegadizo, magnético; pegar, adherir, atraer, colgar
definitions.taso: pero, sin embargo, solamente, (partícula) [marca una frase como contradictoria]
definitions.tawa: ir, moverse; para, hacia; desde la perspectiva de; mover algo | ALT (pv.) ir a ...
definitions.telo: agua, líquido, fluído, sustancia húmeda; bebestible
definitions.tenpo: tiempo, duración, momento, ocasión, periodo, situación
definitions.toki: comunicar, decir, hablar, usar el lenguaje, pensar; idioma, lengua; ¡hola!
definitions.tomo: edificio, casa, hogar, habitación; espacio interior, espacio techado, espacio cerrado
definitions.tonsi: no binari(o/a/e), género no conforme | ALT trans, transgénero, no cisgénero
definitions.usawi: magia, brujería, hechicería; encantar, hechizar; mágico, sobrenatural, oculto, incomprensible
definitions.utala: batallar, desafiar, competir, forcejear, tener dificultad para
definitions.walo: blanco, blancuzco; de color claro, pálido
definitions.wasoweli: un animal que posee cualidades tanto de waso como de soweli
definitions.wawa: fuerte, fuerza, poderoso; seguro, confiado, confianza; enérgico, energía, intenso
definitions.weka: ausente, no presente, ignorado, eliminado; desaparecer, eliminar
definitions.wekama: salir y volver, estar temporalmente ausente con la expectativa de regresar
definitions.wuwojiti: usar una de las sílabas "prohibidas": wu, wo, ji y ti; romper las reglas fonotácticas de Toki Pona
definitions.yupekosi: hacer como George Lucas y editar tus obras creativas anteriores pero en realidad solo empeorarlas

awen.definition: keep, care for, hold (in a particular state)

kama.definition: event, arrive, happen, become, bring about, summon

kamalawala.definition: 'arrival of no government', the beginning of anarchy

kokosila.definition: to speak among Esperantists in a language other than Esperanto

konwe.definition: John Conway, creator of The Game of Life

omekapo.definition: 'eat a good fish', wishing somebody well

pu.definition: unworked wood, sincere, honest, inherent quality, simple

taki.definition: the sound of two magnets hitting each other (onomatopoeia)

sp_etymology.a: radical de exclamación (!) + letra latina minúscula A. compara con o
sp_etymology.akesi: pictograma de un lagarto. los ojos son el radical de los animales
sp_etymology.ala: marca X, un símbolo translingüístico de negación
sp_etymology.alasa: pictograma de un arco con flecha
sp_etymology.anpa: radical de ubicación + contenedor; el último quizás de un cuadro truncado para un objeto general (compara con sinpin) o un contenedor (compara con poki). para el radical, vea también cómo se usa puntos en los blissymbols; compara con el blissymbol "abajo"
sp_etymology.ante: quizás una alteración de sama, o una combinación de sama y ala. quizás un ideograma que representa una divergencia de dos líneas
sp_etymology.awen: motion radical; legs facing against each other, implying standing
sp_etymology.esun: not from a currency symbol (sonja confirmed; said “i think that one is from Mikmaq” but couldn't find a mikmaq symbol similar to it).
sp_etymology.ijo: a circle, for a general object
sp_etymology.ike: pictogram of a frowning mouth. compare pona
sp_etymology.ilo: perhaps a pictogram of a hammer
sp_etymology.jan: head radical; pictogram of a person showing the shoulders
sp_etymology.jo: perhaps a pictogram of a person pointing at themself or holding something
sp_etymology.kama: motion radical; legs facing to the left. compare tawa and blissymbol “walk”
sp_etymology.kijetesantakalu: a drawing of a raccoon with a tail
sp_etymology.kili: pictogram of a fruit, perhaps an apple
sp_etymology.kiwen: pictogram of a rock or a gem
sp_etymology.kon: ideogram; wavy lines to indicate the fluidity of gas. compare telo
sp_etymology.konwe: pictogram of a glider in Conway's Game of Life, a machine which moves across the game board.
sp_etymology.ku: pictogram of the front cover of “Toki Pona Dictionary”, depicting a jacket with a toki pona patch.
sp_etymology.kule: color radical; perhaps the horizontal line indicates the sense of “the concept itself”. or perhaps a pictogram of light passing through a prism (color radical)
sp_etymology.kulupu: pictogram of a group consisting of three members represented by circles
sp_etymology.kute: pictogram of an ear. compare blissymbol “ear”
sp_etymology.la: perhaps related to blissymbol “later” and “ago”, or perhaps a parenthesis
sp_etymology.lawa: head radical; perhaps the horizontal line for the same reason as in kule. alternatively perhaps a pictogram of a person wearing a cap
sp_etymology.len: perhaps a pictogram of a piece of fabric
sp_etymology.lili: ideogram showing smaller size compared to suli
sp_etymology.lipu: pictogram of a sheet of paper. compare blissymbol “paper”
sp_etymology.lon: location radical above a line. compare blissymbol “over”
sp_etymology.lukin: pictogram of an eye. compare blissymbol “eye”
sp_etymology.lupa: pictogram of a concave surface. compare nena
sp_etymology.mama: head radical; perhaps the smaller circle representing the child
sp_etymology.mani: a pictogram of a large domestic animal, such as a cow (sonja confirmed)
sp_etymology.mi: perhaps a hand pointing towards the speaker. compare sina and ona
sp_etymology.mije: head radical with perhaps wide shoulders. compare jan
sp_etymology.moli: head radical; a dead person, represented by the crossed eyes
sp_etymology.monsuta: visual representation of shaking as seen in cartoons
sp_etymology.mun: pictogram of a crescent moon. compare blissymbol “moon”
sp_etymology.musi: perhaps a pictogram of a smile with rosy cheeks or a lyre
sp_etymology.mute: ideogram consisting of three tally marks. compare wan and tu
sp_etymology.n: exclamation radical with the lowercase letter “n”
sp_etymology.nasa: perhaps spiral representing “dizziness”, as can be commonly seen in Japanese manga and anime
sp_etymology.nasin: ideogram consisting of an arrow along a vertical line
sp_etymology.nena: pictogram of a convex surface. compare lupa
sp_etymology.nimi: perhaps a pictogram of a nametag or sitelen pona cartouche
sp_etymology.noka: pictogram of a foot with an ankle
sp_etymology.o: exclamation radical + Latin lowercase letter O. compare a
sp_etymology.olin: two heart symbols (♡), perhaps to distinguish from pilin. [alternate] pilin with emitters
sp_etymology.ona: perhaps a hand pointing sideways. compare mi and sina
sp_etymology.open: perhaps a pictogram of an opened container
sp_etymology.pan: perhaps a pictogram of a grain crop
sp_etymology.pimeja: color radical; perhaps the cross representing the absence of light
sp_etymology.pipi: animal radical; pictogram of a bug
sp_etymology.pona: pictogram of a smiling mouth. compare ike
sp_etymology.pu: pictogram of the cover of the book “Toki Pona: The Language of Good”. alternatively a semantic compound glyph of lipu and toki pona
sp_etymology.seli: perhaps a pictogram of a lit campfire or a simplified pictogram of a fire
sp_etymology.sijelo: perhaps a pictogram of a torso
sp_etymology.sike: two circles, perhaps to distinguish from ijo. alternatively outline of a thick empty circle
sp_etymology.sina: perhaps a hand pointing towards the listener. compare mi and ona
sp_etymology.sitelen: perhaps a representation of symbols on a piece of paper (lipu)
sp_etymology.soweli: animal radical; pictogram of a mammal
sp_etymology.su: pictogram of the front cover of The Wizard of Oz illustrated story book, depicting the yellow brick road from the story
sp_etymology.suli: ideogram showing bigger size compared to lili
sp_etymology.supa: pictogram of a table. compare blissymbol “table”
sp_etymology.suwi: perhaps a pictogram of a smiling face
sp_etymology.tan: a leaping arrow pointing from right to left, implying derivation or cause
sp_etymology.tawa: motion radical; legs facing to the right. compare kama and blissymbol “walk”
sp_etymology.tenpo: pictogram of a clock. compare blissymbol “time”
sp_etymology.toki: emitters + ijo or a general circle
sp_etymology.tomo: pictogram of a house. compare blissymbol “house”
sp_etymology.tu: two tally marks. compare mute and wan
sp_etymology.unpa: perhaps a derivation of heart symbol (especially visible from the original drawing of the character), or a knot pattern implying intercourse, or perhaps a pictogram of a genitalia
sp_etymology.walo: color radical; perhaps the reverse of pimeja, the color radical cutting of the cross instead of vice versa
sp_etymology.wan: one tally mark or Indo-Arabic numeral 1, perhaps to make it more distinct
sp_etymology.waso: animal radical; pictogram of a bird
sp_etymology.wawa: perhaps a pictogram of a person with raised arms, to signify strength
sp_etymology.weka: “poof lines”; indicating the movement of something disappearing
